content.question: Which of the following is a correct statement about the fusion reaction?

choices.label: The mass of the reactants is equal to the mass of the products because mass is conserved.
The mass of the reactants is greater than the mass of the products because fusion creates a larger atom.
The total mass-energy of the reactants is equal to the total mass-energy of the products because of conservation of mass-energy.
The total mass-energy of the reactants is greater than the total mass-energy of the products because photons are released in the process.

content.answer: The total mass-energy of the reactants is equal to the total mass-energy of the products because of conservation of mass-energy.
